From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of marji
Sent: Tuesday, May 23, 2006 2:35 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [unschoolingbasics] Milk


At 14:51 5/23/2006, you wrote:
>Ren, could you send me info that supports that. I would love to have it
for
>my dh!
>In Gratitude,
>
>Christy Putnam
>Unschooling Mom to Aden (1) and Seth (11)
>Loving wife of Chet (ann. 7/4/04)


Well, I'm not Ren, but here's some information:

http://notmilk.com/calcium/index.html

http://notmilk.com/calcium/excesscalcium.html (with lots of references)

and, specifically,
http://notmilk.com/calcium/protein-cons.html


I hope that helps!

Marji

messages.subject: Milk
messages.msgSnippet: Ren, could you send me info that supports that.  Nope, but I can tell you to Google it!:) I am trying to pack and finish speeches and clean house and work
messages.messageBody:
"Ren, could you send me info that supports that. "

Nope, but I can tell you to Google it!:)
I am trying to pack and finish speeches and clean house and work
tomorrow in order to make my flight to Peabody on time.....no time for
much of anything else right now.

Google is an unschoolers best friend!

Ren
learninginfreedom.com

From: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Ren Allen
Sent: Monday, May 15, 2006 8:55 PM
To: unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [unschoolingbasics] Milk


"The reason that milk became the drink to have is
because it is an easy way for parents to get calcium, iron, protein and
calories into children. "

And actually, there is so much protein that it uses up the calcium
anyway...drinking milk for calcium is pretty useless.

Ren
learninginfreedom.com
